figures_and_tables_captions.caption: A diagram of the evaluation function with “secret holder” style payoff described in Example 11.
Causal graphs, where (a) corresponds to the DGP (3) and (b) corresponds to (4).

The (a) SAGE values for the DGP in (4) across a grid of 0.05 ≤ ℓ ≤ 0.95, (b) Shapley values for the mean absolute SHAP, SAGE and m function formulations, for the difference ϕ1 − ϕ2 between attribution to X1 and X2, across the same range of ℓ values. Similar results were observed for the difference ϕ1 − ϕ3. Values ϕ1 − ϕ2 < 0 indicate regions of the parameter space for which model selection results are inadequate.

Grid points (t1, t2) for −2 ≤ ti ≤ 2 at 0.05 increments, in the parameter space for the DGP (6) described in Section IV-C. Points in orange are where ϕi − ϕ1 > 0, as well as C({1, i}) − C({2, 3}) > 0, for both i = 2 and i = 3.
